document.publication: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Variorum Edition, Franklin, 1998
document.full_text: <xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan"> </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">Could </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">mortal </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">lip </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">divine </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">The </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">undeveloped </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">Freight </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">Of </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">a </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#5c94ff">delivered </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">syllable </xhtml:span></xhtml:p><xhtml:p class="text_p"><xhtml:span class="text_edgespan">    </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">'Twould </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">crumble </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">with </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_word">the </xhtml:span><xhtml:span class="text_coloredword" style="color:#60c8ff">weight. </xhtml:span></xhtml:p>
document.title: Could mortal lip divine
